name: Cinnamon Sugar Vegan Donuts
description: The best thing about these vegan donuts is how easy they are to make! Everyone will love these cinnamon sugar coated donuts that are baked, not fried.

video.name: Cinnamon Sugar Vegan Donuts
video.description: Everyone will love these cinnamon sugar coated donuts that are baked, not fried.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and spray a donut pan with non-stick spray.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and spray a donut pan with non-stick spray.

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk the flour, sugar, baking powder, salt and cinnamon in a large bowl. Pour the soy milk, applesauce, melted vegan butter (1 tablespoon) and vanilla into the bowl with the dry ingredients. Mix well with a large wooden spoon to combine. The batter will be similar to cake batter; not too thick but not very runny either.
recipeInstructions.name: Whisk the flour, sugar, baking powder, salt and cinnamon in a large bowl. Pour the soy milk, applesauce, melted vegan butter (1 tablespoon) and vanilla into the bowl with the dry ingredients. Mix well with a large wooden spoon to combine. The batter will be similar to cake batter; not too thick but not very runny either.

recipeInstructions.text: Spoon the batter into the donut pan, OR fill a large ziplock bag with the batter, cut a hole in the corner and pipe into the pan, filling about 3/4 of the way full. Be careful not to overfill, as the donuts will rise and you might lose the "hole" of your donut.
recipeInstructions.name: Spoon the batter into the donut pan, OR fill a large ziplock bag with the batter, cut a hole in the corner and pipe into the pan, filling about 3/4 of the way full. Be careful not to overfill, as the donuts will rise and you might lose the "hole" of your donut.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 9-10 minutes or until the edges are lightly golden brown. If your donut pan is larger than mine, they could take a few extra minutes to bake. Let cool for two or three minutes in the pan, then carefully transfer to a wire rack with a large piece of parchment paper beneath it (to help with the mess).
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 9-10 minutes or until the edges are lightly golden brown. If your donut pan is larger than mine, they could take a few extra minutes to bake. Let cool for two or three minutes in the pan, then carefully transfer to a wire rack with a large piece of parchment paper beneath it (to help with the mess).

itemListElement.text: Stir together the sugar and cinnamon for the topping in a medium bowl, and melt the vegan butter in a separate bowl.
itemListElement.name: Stir together the sugar and cinnamon for the topping in a medium bowl, and melt the vegan butter in a separate bowl.

itemListElement.text: Dip the donuts into the melted butter, both sides or just one side if you prefer. Then dunk the donut into the cinnamon sugar mixture to coat.
itemListElement.name: Dip the donuts into the melted butter, both sides or just one side if you prefer. Then dunk the donut into the cinnamon sugar mixture to coat.

itemListElement.text: Serve immediately, or within one day for best results. Leftover donuts will keep for two days at most, covered and at room temperature.
itemListElement.name: Serve immediately, or within one day for best results. Leftover donuts will keep for two days at most, covered and at room temperature.
